pullRequest.body:
Characterize small sifted as those for which the `Type`-valued colimit functor preserves finite product. Deduce that filtered categories, and that categories admitting a final functor from a sifted categories are also sifted.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Second part of what used to be #17554. The core of the proof relies on a few private lemmas/defs (`colimBoxIsoColimTensColim` and `factorization_prod_comparison_colim` being the most important ones) and I don‚Äôt know if that can be avoided.

I am still unsure wether or not the part relating sifted categories to filtered categories should be split off in a different file to avoid importing `CategoryTheory/Limits/FilteredColimitCommutesFiniteLimit.lean` every time `CategoryTheory/Limits/Sifted.lean` is imported.
The fact that filtered categories are sifted can also be proved without the characterization in this PR (it reduces essentially to `IsFiltered.bowtie`), and so it could also stay in this file with less imports, but I find it nicer to do it using the characterization.

- [ ] depends on: #17766 
- [x] depends on: #17779  

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Functor.toMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts`
`+ Functor.toOplaxMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts`
`+ IsSifted.of_final_functor_from_sifted`
`+ PreservesTerminalIso`
`+ PreservesTerminalIso_hom`
`+ Types.tensorProductAdjunction`
`+ colimPreservesBinaryProductsOfIsSifted`

`+ colimPreservesLimitsOfPairsOfIsSifted`
`+ colimPreservesLimitsOfShapePEmtyOfIsSifted`
`+ colimPreservesTerminalObjectOfIsSifted`
`+ expUnitIsoSelf`
`+ expUnitNatIso`
`+ instance (X : Type v‚ÇÅ) : (tensorLeft X).IsLeftAdjoint`
`+ instance : ChosenFiniteProducts (CondensedSet.{u})`
`+ instance : ChosenFiniteProducts (LightCondSet.{u})`
`+ instance : IsIso (ChosenFiniteProducts.prodComparison colim X Y) := by`
`+ instance : PreservesColimits (tensorLeft A)`
`+ instance [F.IsEquivalence] : F.toMonoidalFunctorOfChosenFiniteProducts.IsEquivalence := by`
`+ instance [HasSheafify J A] [ChosenFiniteProducts A] : ChosenFiniteProducts (Sheaf J A)`
`+ instance [HasSheafify J A] [ChosenFiniteProducts A] [CartesianClosed (C·µí·µñ ‚•§ A)] :`
`+ inv_prodComparison_map_fst`
`+ inv_prodComparison_map_snd`
`+ isIso_prodComparison_of_preservesLimit_pair:`
`+ isLimitChosenFiniteProductsOfPreservesLimits`
`+ isSiftedOrEmpty_of_colimit_preservesBinaryProducts`
`+ isSiftedOrEmpty_of_colimit_preservesFiniteProducts`
`+ map_toUnit_comp_terminalCompariso`
`+ nonempty_of_colimit_preservesLimitsOfShapeFinZero`
`+ of_colimit_preservesFiniteProducts`
`+ of_final_functor_from_sifted'`
`+ of_isFiltered`
`+ preservesLimitEmptyOfIsIsoTerminalComparison`
`+ preservesLimitPairOfIsIsoProdComparison`
`+ preservesLimitsOfShapeDiscreteWalkingPairOfIsoProdComparison`
`+ prodComparison`
`+ prodComparisonBifunctorNatTrans`
`+ prodComparisonBifunctorsNatIso`
`+ prodComparisonIso`
`+ prodComparisonIso_hom`
`+ prodComparisonNatIso`
`+ prodComparisonNatTrans`
`+ prodComparison_comp`
`+ prodComparison_fst`
`+ prodComparison_inv_natural`
`+ prodComparison_inv_natural_whiskerLeft`
`+ prodComparison_inv_natural_whiskerRight`
`+ prodComparison_natural`
`+ prodComparison_natural_whiskerLeft`
`+ prodComparison_natural_whiskerRight`
`+ prodComparison_snd`
`+ reflectiveChosenFiniteProducts`
`+ terminalComparison`
`+ terminalComparison_isIso_of_preservesLimits`
`+ uniqueHomsetOfInitialIsoUnit`
`- Types.binaryProductAdjunction`
`- expTerminalIsoSelf`
`- expTerminalNatIso`
`- instance (X : Type v‚ÇÅ) : (Types.binaryProductFunctor.obj X).IsLeftAdjoint`
`- instance : PreservesColimits (prod.functor.obj A)`
`- instance [HasSheafify J A] [HasFiniteProducts A] [CartesianClosed (C·µí·µñ ‚•§ A)] :`
`- uniqueHomsetOfInitialIsoTerminal`

</details>

</details>
